text: Psalm 138
Thanksgiving for Yahweh’s Goodness
Of David.\f + \fr Ps 138 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
I give you thanks with my whole heart;
before \add the\add* gods I sing your praise.
I bow down toward your holy temple
and give thanks to your name,
because of your loyal love and faithfulness,
for you have magnified your word\f + \fr 138:2 \ft Or “promise” \f* according to all your name.\f + \fr 138:2 \ft Or “beyond all your name” \f*
⸤When⸥\f + \fr 138:3 \ft Literally “In the day” \f* I called and you answered me,
you emboldened me in my soul \add with\add* strength.
All \add the\add* kings of \add the\add* earth
will praise you, O Yahweh,
when they have heard the words\f + \fr 138:4 \ft Or “heard about the words” \f* of your mouth,
and they will sing of the ways of Yahweh,
because Yahweh’s glory \add is\add* great.
Though Yahweh \add is\add* high, yet he sees \add the\add* lowly,
but \add the\add* proud he perceives\f + \fr 138:6 \ft Hebrew “knows” \f* at a distance.
Though I walk in the midst of trouble,
you preserve me alive.
You stretch out your hand against the anger of my enemies,
and you save me \add with\add* your right hand.
Yahweh accomplishes \add things\add* for my benefit.
O Yahweh, your loyal love \add endures\add* forever;
do not abandon the works of your hands.
